citations.desc: Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers.
citations.narrative:
The following information was missing and not attached to the outside of the primary enclosures of 30 dogs on flight
C2591, PVG to LAX, AWB784-32957304 on 19 May 2025 :
1) The time and date the animal was last fed and watered and the specific instructions for the next feeding (s) and
watering (s) for a 24-hour period and 2) The consignor’s signature and the date and time certification was signed. The
airline provides a Live Animals Acceptance Check List but under the section Feeding and Watering, it was marked N/A (
not applicable).
Carriers and intermediate handlers must not accept a dog for transport in commerce unless the consignor certifies in
writing that the dog was offered food and water within 4 hours of transport and provides specific instructions for feeding
and watering in a 24-hour period. The certification and instructions must be securely attached to the outside of the
enclosure so that it is easily noticed and read.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a cargo facility manager.
n

narrative:
3.14(c) 
   
Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers. 
The following information was missing and not attached to the outside of the primary enclosures of 30 dogs on flight 
C2591, PVG to LAX, AWB784-32957304 on 19 May 2025 :  
1) The time and date the animal was last fed and watered and the specific instructions for the next feeding (s) and 
watering (s) for a 24-hour period and 2) The consignor’s signature and the date and time certification was signed. The 
airline provides a Live Animals Acceptance Check List but under the section Feeding and Watering, it was marked N/A ( 
not applicable). 
Carriers and intermediate handlers must not accept a dog for transport in commerce unless the consignor certifies in 
writing that the dog was offered food and water within 4 hours of transport and provides specific instructions for feeding 
and watering in a 24-hour period. The certification and instructions must be securely attached to the outside of the 
enclosure so that it is easily noticed and read. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a cargo facility manager. 
 
 n
